page.title: 10TRIP TO THE PAST
page.content: Old forms of the name {COCKENZIE} were COWKENNY or COKENNY. Some people still pronounce it COKENNY. The place began as 2 rows of Fishermen's homes on either side of a dirt track near the shore. There was a natural harbour there protected by the rocks or craigs. It became a {BURGH}in 1592 by permission of King James 1V. Several harbours have been destroyed by storms, the worst being in 1635. Fishermen now use Port Seton harbour opened in 1880 rather than the older Cockenzie harbour. Former{INDUSTRIES} included coalmining, saltpanning, pottery, glassmaking, flourmilling and lobster fishing. A very old wooden railway used to bring coal in bogies to Cockenzie harbour for export. Salt too was exported and about 9000 oysters daily used to be caught.
